recipe.ingredients: - apples (peeled, cored, and sliced): 6 cups - lemon juice: 1 tablespoon - granulated sweetener suitable for diabetics (e.g., stevia): 1/4 cup - ground cinnamon: 1 teaspoon - rolled oats: 3/4 cup - whole wheat flour: 1/2 cup - brown sugar substitute (e.g., Splenda Brown Sugar Blend): 1/3 cup - unsalted butter (melted): 4 tablespoons
recipe.directions: 1. Prepare Apples: In a large bowl, toss the sliced apples with lemon juice, granulated sweetener, and 1/2 teaspoon of cinnamon. 2. Arrange Apples: Transfer the apple mixture to a greased baking dish. 3. Make Crisp Topping: In another bowl, mix the rolled oats, whole wheat flour, brown sugar substitute, remaining cinnamon, and melted butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. 4. Bake: Sprinkle the oat mixture evenly over the apples. Bake in a preheated oven at 350°F (175°C) for about 30-35 minutes or until the topping is golden brown and the apples are tender. 5. Serve: Allow to cool slightly before serving, preferably with a dollop of low-fat vanilla yogurt or diabetic vanilla ice cream if desired.
